step.name: Importing Data into RapidMiner.
step.text: Getting your data into RapidMiner is often the first task you will need to complete your analysis. In this tutorial, you will learn how to import files into the central storage of RapidMiner, called the Repository. We will continue to use data describing the Titanic accident, but this time it will be imported from an Excel file.
step.info: We will now go through the most important steps of building analytical processes starting with data import. In later tutorials, we will cover data preparation and modeling. We also will discuss some of the steps you saw so far in more detail.

step.name: Download your data.

tasks.task: Download this Excel file to your computer.
To import the downloaded data into RapidMiner, click 16/add.png Import Data in the Repository panel and follow the steps in the wizard.
When you complete the import, store the data as Titanic in your Local Repository.

step.info: The Repository panel, in the upper left corner by default, is the place to store all your data, processes, and results. You should always import data into the repository, especially when it comes from files like XLS or CSV. This will simplify the design of analytical processes a lot since RapidMiner's repository stores describing meta data together with the data.

step.name: Add data to the process.

tasks.task: Click the Design tab to return to the Process panel.
Drag the imported Titanic data from the Repository panel into the Process panel.

step.info: When you drag data from the repository into the process, it transforms into a data-loading operator (in this case, Retrieve Titanic). Data is not actually loaded (or delivered at the round output ports of each operator) until you run the process.

step.name: Create a connection to view results.

tasks.task: Connect the output port of Retrieve Titanic with the result port ("res") on the right side of the Process panel.
Make the connection either by dragging a line between the ports, or by first clicking on one port and then on the other port.

step.info: Only data which is delivered to one of the result ports on the right can be seen after the execution of the process. If your process does not have at least one connection to a result port, you won't see any results when you execute it!

step.name: Execute the process.

tasks.task: Press 16/media_play.png Run (top left) to execute the process.

step.info: Once run, you automatically switch to the Results view where your results are displayed. Remember? Those are operator outputs you connected with one of the result ports on the right side of the Process panel. At any time, click the Design tab to return to the Process panel.

step.name: Congratulations!
step.text: You just have imported your first data set! From now on, each tutorial includes some additional questions - to further improve your skills - take a look at the challenges below!

questions.question: You can see the data in the results. Can you find out how missing values are shown?
The Statistics tab shows summaries of the data in the columns. How many people did travel in First class? And how many people did not survive the Titanic accident?
Play around with some of the Charts if you like. Can you see some interesting patterns?
